The menu offers interesting, upscale versions of your favorite comfort foods. I ordered the jumbo lump crab and asparagus salad, which I really, really enjoyed. The hearts of palm were a nice, unique addition. It was the perfect portion for a pre-going-out dinner, and very generous with the crab. For dessert, our party ordered the donut holes with chocolate and caramel dipping sauces, which were also delicious. 

Service was outstanding. We had multiple servers for our large party, keeping our champagne glasses full, and all of them professional and hospitable above all standards. 

I do wish they had a bathroom in the restaurant... it's quite a walk to the casino restroom, especially in heels and after some bubbly. The food wasn't the most memorable I've ever had, but the great service made our experience special. I'd love to come back for the breakfast that everyone raves about.
Cute place, good service and the pear mojito might be the best drink I've ever had. I would go back just for that drink.

Was at Society Cafe for a super bowl party.  Paid 85/person which included a set menu family syle.  The food was very good overall.  The service was terrible.  Our server changed three times and I think they got worse each time.  
Will not go back again.

Awesome food...ahi tuna amazing, mac n cheese bites were very good also! The complimentary pretzel sticks were soft and delicious. The Dream mixed drink was delicious as well as the blackberry margarita.

Very rarely do I feel so passionately about a business that I review them mere hours after leaving. Let me start by saying the food here was AMAZING. Everyone was very pleased with their meals and portions were fabulous. With that being said, we had some of the worst service ever. We were a party of 12 for a bachelorette dinner and requested a certain table upon making the reservations. We were told that table was unavailable when we arrived, and were sat elsewhere. Ok, no big deal. Then we sat for about 15 minutes before ANYTHING happened. No water, no drink orders, no bread, nothing. Once we placed our drink orders, it was about a half hour before any of them came. In fact, they came AFTER some of the appetizers. Entrees came after awhile also, but no appetizer plates were cleared so there was no room on the table. Some peoples' sides were incorrect, but the food was great so we tried to power through. Everything was SO slow that we were there for over two hours. When we asked to speak to the manager, he couldn't have cared less that we were disappointed. All in all the food was great but we were so surprised that the service was so bad. If our server was new, I understand it. But considering we didn't really have any crazy requests or substitutions or anything it was pretty bad.

Great restaurant inside Encore by the casino.  Reservations are not needed and it was fairly quick service.  I had dinner here around 9pm on a Saturday night and only waited a few minutes for a table.  I also had breakfast here at 9am on a Sunday morning (with a reservation) and it was steady, but not insanely packed.  The decor was bright and trendy with a good vibe.  

Now, onto the food....

On my first visit I had the vegan tomato bisque as an appetizer -it was fantastic!  I was shocked that it was vegan, but still so creamy!  For my entree I had the Wynn "burger" with fries and raspberry sorbet.  The burger was good, Gardein "beef" patty, vegan cheese and all the typical burger toppings and a side of fries.  Very tasty and easy on the wallet.  Usually it comes with a shake, but I don't like chocolate so the server offered sorbet instead...it was great!  The burger, fries and shake meal is only $11!  With my soup my total was a little over $22, but that's cheap for a Vegas meal!  

Onto my breakfast the next day...

I started with a green juice for $10.  I'm a big green juice fan, so $10 for a fresh juice didn't seem too bad.  Well, this is where Society gets knocked down a star.  I saw the bartender pour it in my glass from a big plastic jug under the bar.  For $10/glass I think it should have been fresh pressed!!  

For my entree I had the Florentine Tofu Benedict.  It was really good and a healthy option as well.  It had a great smokey flavor and I really enjoyed it.  It came with a cucumber salad on the side, which was okay, but I think a side of fresh fruit would have been a better choice.  With my juice and Benedict, my total was about $28 before tip.  A little pricy due to the juice situation, but I was still pleased.

A nice change from Starbucks. 
Comparable with the national chains and less burn-y flavored coffee, all four people in our party enjoyed our coffee, tea, and pastries. The pastries in particular with well portioned and fresh without being overly heavy. We had carrot cake, raspberry coffee cake, and a mango coconut layered cake. 

The only down side to this place is it can get REALLY loud. It's the first place to eat coming out of  the Encore and Wynn theaters. Across the way is the far larger and busier Allegro. Between the two, the gaming floor opens up. So yeah, noisy!

The only other plus is it's LITERALLY less than 5 minutes walk from the entrance of the Level 2 self park parking garage.

We've had 3 great experiences here. For a late lunch, breakfast and carry out. 

The society chopped salad w grilled chicken, ha artz, jicama, edamame, and lettuce was delicious. Crunchy. Refreshing. The husband opted for lobster roll for 21$ vs a $19 burger was delicious. Overflowing w creamy lobster on a warm buttery toasted bun. Mmmmmm. 

We came back for breakfast the next morning and after looking at the yelp reviews decided in the huckleberry soufflé pancakes, the filet sliders and a side of short rib hash. Amazing. The hash was tender with an umami flavor. The pancakes were also delicious but almost too thick and not as airy as I would expect. The sliders were delicious with tender filet, creamy spinach on a hear bisque the that had some melted hardened cheese on the edges. Mmmmmm. 

For takeout the same day I ordered the Greek kale salad w grilled chicken. Chicken  was juicy and tender. Kale and grapes w smoked almonds was refreshing w a slight bite from the pickled onions. So good. Enjoyed it poolside. 

Our service was also great. Try were nice and prompt , refilled waters timely, asked about allergies. Offered a coffee refill to go. 

A bit overpriced but overall great

This place is pretty much perfect! The ambience is elegant and relaxing. Every dish we ordered was delicious. I highly recommend the traditional eggs Benedict and the monkey bread appetizer. 

Tip: there is a dress code and women can't wear spaghetti strap tank tops-- we learned that lesson the hard way. 

I had the chopped salad that was very nice. I the balsamic vinaigrette.

The service was excellent. 

This is a very relaxing place for lunch. 

For my wife it was a five for me it was a 4. And because I down up I give it a 4

My husband and I had an excellent breakfast on Saturday morning. Wonderful service and fantastic coffee. Yes, it's expensive, but so is everything in Las Vegas. Breakfast the next morning at the Terrace in the Wynn, although a couple dollars less expensive, was not nearly as good nor as nice of an experience, by a long shot.

Society Café I hate to see you go!!! I decided at the spur of the moment to head down with some friends last night since I know that they are closing!! I love the concept of the café and the entire ambiance is seriously amazing! If you hadn't experienced it then you definitely missed out! For starters when we walked in we were warmly greeted by a couple of very friendly hostess! Timing was awesome because we were seated immediately and without a reservation! Double plus! The waiter was great he had a lot of insight to the menu as well as very helpful with his recommendations! I started with the Blueberry margarita which isn't something I normally do, I prefer just a straight up traditional margarita but tonight I was getting a bit out of my comfort zone! Freshly made and the blueberries were crushed to perfection! Shaken well! Yum! The complimentary pretzel bread is really good minus ALL THAT SALT! Yikes! My friends ordered the fried macaroni cheese bites as an appetizer and WOW! I hope that when they move this café to where Botero use to be then these are a KEEPER on the new menu! As an entrée I went for the Southwest Burger and again another great recommendation by our waiter it was again made to perfection! No complaints at all! We also ordered a side of the Orecchiette Mac n cheese! I'm more of a truffle Mac n Cheese kinda guy but this did just fine! And lastly the famous chocolate cake that towers over you was literally some of the best chocolate cake I've ever had! Wish I tried this place out sooner!

Vegans rejoice!  The Wynn and Encore are thinking about you and are doing vegan with style. All the Wynn restaurants offer vegan menus, because Steve Wynn recently became one. We just had a delicious breakfast at the Society Cafe. The vegetable flatbread was amazing.  My wife had a chopped salad with avacado and a refreshing lemon tarragon dressing. The service was excellent.

Stopped for the Happy Hour specials. The food was only OK- greasy appetizers barely better than bar food. Drinks were weak and watery and an issue over the buy one get one was only handled after a discussion with the manager.

I had the steak&egg slider. Its pretty good, but I don't think it's worth $20. However, consider its inside Encore, I guess it's alright. My husband had the panini. I really didn't like it. My husband didn't even touch it at all, the panini bread is really hard, like a rock. My in laws had the steak & egg -$24.... 
I don't think I'd go back again, the price and the entrees didn't have that type of "wow" effect.

Even though the chicken was a bit dry, the service was amazing. The truffle oil mashed potatoes were heavenly, and...

The dessert was the absolute best part of the meal. Creme brulee cheesecake. You absolutely must try it, and the warm doughnuts with dipping sauces are also fantastic.

Order dessert first, then maybe a meal if you are still hungry.

I really liked this place especially before going into club XS! I was there for new years with my girls and we had great service and good food!  The drinks were a little expensive but the plates are worth splitting and the drinks are good! The sangria at the bar was really good!  Not to pricey which is nice to have in Vegas! I felt like i was on the set of Gosip Girl with the atmosphere! I loves it here.

Everything in the Encore/Wynn is overpriced but at least the $15 french toast they served me at Society was pretty darn good. I loved the caramelized bananas. The problem here was the service and the fact that they ran out of apple juice and sticky buns by 11AM. Our waiter also kept messing up our orders and was forgetful about refills, etc.  Not only did they run out of apple juice they ended up stlil charging us 10 bucks for it.  The experience was a bit painful.

Good food aplenty at this upscale yet casual cafe at the Encore (Wynn) right next to the club XS.  Simple, priced right, and a nice standard beer menu to wash it down.

If you are a truffling ho like me (not to be confused with a "trifling ho"), Society's menu will have you tricking with your mouth in two seconds flat.  Liberal administration of truffle oil / butter / miscellaneous creamy goodness will have you so weak at the knees I can hardly speak I lose all control then something takes over me.  SWV!

But all kidding aside, truffling hoes will want to avail yourselves and open your mouths to receive the culinary prowess I suggest to the following items you must say yes.  (repeat this sentence in your best Spoken Word voice).

Item Number 1 - The Mac & Cheese Bites.  Every fat kid loves him some Mac & Cheese, and as a former man-breast recipient, I am no except to this rule.  But just like a nice, plump, man-breast, every classic dish needs a nice, hard twist.  Here's Society's twist on Mac & Cheese:  They place their Mac & Cheese into magically delicious and geometrically perfect cubes (with batter of some sort), and fry the living daylights out of them.  The result is a double whammy of flavor, first of the miscellaneous fried pleasure that can make the fishiest of fish and the blandest of vegetables taste like heaven (or I guess, hell, for you goth kids that can't relate), and second, of the Mac & Cheese, duh.  AND I HAVEN'T EVEN GOTTEN TO THE BEST PART YET!  You dip the Mac & Cheese bites into a truffle oil / butter / sauce concoction!  What happens next, in your mouth, folks, is mindblowing.  Not quite as mindblowing as Ricky Martin coming out of the closet, but mindblowing nonetheless.  

Item Number 2 - The Trenne.

I'm all about portmanteaus - "shart" being a particular favorite of mine.  But "trenee" is definitely a close second.  It is a combination of "triangle" and "penne" and explains the peculiarly-shaped pasta used in this dish.  It is, well, triangular penne.  Kind of like a hollow prism.  Actually, exactly like a hollow prism.  But I digress - the shape of the pasta has nothing to do with the flavor of this dish.  This pasta dish is served with a truffle cream sauce, crispy prosciutto, real truffles, and peas.  Men - I can all but guarantee that this dish will get you laid.  Women - I can all but guarantee that some man will read my review and buy you this dish.

Their bone-in peppercorn dry-rub rib-eye (say that ten times fast) is spectacular too, but c'mon, who writes about steak these days?  That was so 2004.

This place left a good taste in my mouth.  So good, in fact, that I didn't brush my teeth last night so I could taste it in the morning.  

I will be back, Society Cafe Encore, I will be back.

Happy truffling!
